This is to inform the general that the university of Prince of Island Admission Application is ongoing for all interested students who wish to apply.

University of Prince of Edward Island Admission Requirements

The steps to apply for admission are as follows:

  • Create a UPEI account
  • Complete an online application
  • Forward your UPEI application fee and completed the application
  • Submit your transcripts and supporting credentials
  • verify your application status by logging into your account
  • Bottom of Form

English Language Proficiency Requirements for Undergraduate programs

  1. Three years of full-time learning in English in Canada or in another country where English is a major language (as recognized by UPEI); confirmation of bilingualism (English and another language) is acceptable for those applicants educated in Canada in a language other than English; OR
  2. Submission of a certified test score at or above the acceptable minimum, such as:
  3. Three years of full-time study in English in Canada or in another country where English is a principal language (as recognized by UPEI); evidence of bilingualism (English and another language) is acceptable for those applicants educated in Canada in a language other than English; OR
  4. Submission of an authorized test score at or beyond the acceptable maximum, such as:
Test Arts, Science, Business and Baccalauréate en éducation, Français Langue Seconde Nursing, Radiography, Doctor of Veterinary Medicine & Education
IELTS (Academic) Overall score of 6.5 with 6.5 in writing no other band below 6 Overall score of 7 with 7 in writing and speaking; 6.5 in reading and listening
TOEFL paper-based test 550 with a minimum TWE of 5.5 600 with least amount TWE of 6
TOEFL internet-based test 80 with a minimum of 20 in each category 100 with a maximum of 25 in vocalization and writing, 22 in reading and listening

Country-Specific Requirements

NIGERIA 

Transcript for grades 10, 11, and 12. Or the senior secondary School Certificate Examination (SSCE) the results are issued directly by WAEC (to be confirmed online). For WAEC, we need a maximum of 4, on the applicable vital subjects assessed are for the program of entrance application submitted to UPEI.

United States of America

maximum for overall ‘B’ average (GPA 2.8 on a 4.0 scale) in a recognized academic grade 12 program. At least 4 different subjects at the matriculation level must be represented in the high school diploma. SAT or ACT results are not essential but may be used for scholarship reference.
